meanings.definition: To sell more than (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: Last month, the new video game outsold all the others.
meanings.sent2: The popular book outsold its competitors in the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The lemonade stand outsold the cookie stand at the school fair.
meanings.sent4: The determined salesperson outsold the competition with ease.
meanings.sent5: The fresh produce outsold the canned goods at the market.

meanings.definition: To be more successful in selling than (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The local bakery outsold the big chain store last weekend.
meanings.sent2: The new toy outsold all the other toys in the store.
meanings.sent3: The clever marketing strategy outsold the traditional approach.
meanings.sent4: The innovative product design outsold the outdated models.
meanings.sent5: The friendly customer service outsold the competitors' rude staff.
